DOC.brief_summary: The objective Program Rehabilitative Exercise Education avert Vascular Events Non-disabling stroke Transient ischemic attack ( PREVENT ) Trial determine whether timely delivery secondary stroke prevention strategy reduce modifiable vascular risk factor two group people survive NDS TIA . One group receive comprehensive education exercise program ( PREVENT ) ; group receive usual care ( USUAL CARE ) . We measure modifiable vascular risk factor group . We also compare effect PREVENT v USUAL CARE exercise capacity , walk endurance , daily physical activity . In addition , compare think ability , depression , achievement personal goal healthy behavior , health-related goal attainment health-related quality life . Finally , compare outcome urban rural setting well cost PREVENT program USUAL CARE order ass sustainability PREVENT program .
DOC.brief_title: Program Rehabilitative Exercise Education Avert Vascular Events After Non-disabling Stroke Transient Ischemic Attack : A Multi-site RCT
DOC.criteria: Males female Over 17 year age . Diagnosis first probable definite TIA nondisabling stroke ( National Institutes Health Stroke Scale < 6 ) Postevent interval < 90 day . Residence within 75 km intervention site . Orientation time , place person ability follow simple 3step command . Ability willingness provide inform consent . Evidence intracranial hemorrhage MRI CT scan . Presence contraindication exercise test training , accordance American College Sports Medicine Guidelines . Participation another study could potentially confound outcomes trial .
